title: (x)Town & Country travel magazine - Requiem, Bell Gothic {Tiff}
content:
if anyone has this magazine, can you help me identify the font used for the articles.... thanks you so much!!!!!!

 [‹ (x) Disco 76 - Optex {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4000 "Go to previous forum topic") [Roman numerals ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3983 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: Ach, why not post a sample? I haven't got your mag...

Do you mean [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/magazines.ivillage.com/townandcountry?arrivalSA=1&cobrandRef=0&arrival_freqCap=1&pba=adid=7635983)? What typeface do you want identified:   
headlines, body copy, captions, streamers, ...?

TC ... I do know that Town & Country uses [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/requiem/index.html). But without the mag in front of me I can't remember the sans.

Well they use quite a bit of [Avenir](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/avenir/) on the website, as   
well as [Adobe Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adobe-garamond/). The mast head looks like   
 [News Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/news-gothic/demi/testdrive.html?s=Town%26Country&p=48)/ [Benton Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=108034334919162&fontname=BentonSans).
thanks for all tyour help!! i think it may be releqiem
I'll look at a T&C during my Saturday pilgrimage to Border's. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

thanks tiffany!   
when you go, specifically look at the page with the listing of all the editors... that is the font i am looking for. thank again ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080929203004im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
TC -- It looked like Bell Gothic in the masthead paired with Requiem. Really bizarre considering the rest of the magazine seems to be using a Trade Gothic looking typeface.
